roleset.name: directed motion

example.name: lead an activity
example.text: Urging [LIN directors]-1 *trace*-1 to conduct ``a fair auction on a level playing field,'' ...

example.name: passivized
example.text: [The study]-1, conducted *trace*-1 by a task force of the Brookings Institution, suggests that Congress should require the courts to develop the plans.
example.arg: by a task force of the Brookings Institution

example.name: lead music
example.text: I, for instance, was perfectly happy at Avery Fisher Hall the other day listening to Helmuth Rilling conduct the Messa per Rossini, a strange piece written by 13 different Italian composers to honor Rossini after his death in 1868.
example.arg: the Messa per Rossini, a strange piece written by 13 different Italian composers to honor Rossini after his death in 1868

roleset.note: Based on sentences in financial subcorpus.Comparison with lead. Member of VNcls accompany-51.7.

example.text: We all thought little Max conducted himself very well.

roleset.name: transmit, be a medium

example.name: both args
example.text: Of the metals, silver conducts electricity the best, although it is relatively expensive.

example.name: adjectival rel: conductive
example.text: Did practice prove that contempt for the Taiwanese people was not conductive to unification ?

roleset.note: Added by Julia. Adjectival 'conductive' based on BOLT-7.
